question: Which of the following is the doctrine of ‘non-onesidedness’ or ‘manifoldness’ or ‘nonabsolutism’?
explanation: Opposed to the philosophy of ekanta which means one-sidedness or solitary attribute the Jaina doctrine of Anekantavada is the doctrine of ‘non-onesidedness’ or ‘manifoldness’ or ‘nonabsolutism’.
